title: Various Watchmen Graphic Novel Fonts
content:
Could you folks help me identify (or find the closest real world matches to) many of the fonts used in the Watchmen graphic novel? I understand that many of these fonts are hand drawn, but again, what I'm looking for are their closest real world counterparts. Any help at all would be greatly appreciated!

1) The End Is Nigh:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/the-end-is-nigh_4959.jpg)

--  
2) Gunga Diner:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gunga-diner3_3610.jpg)

--  
3) New York Gazette:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/new-york-gazette2_5887.jpg)

--  
4) New Frontiersman:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/new-frontiersman_5964.jpg)

--  
5) Happy Harry's:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/happy-harrys_6015.jpg)

--  
6) Nova Express:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nova-express_3510.jpg)

--  
7) Pale Horse:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/pale-horse_4929.jpg)

--  
8) Rafael's:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/rafaels_5780.jpg)

--  
9) Gordon's Gin:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/gordons-gin_4576.jpg)

--  
10) Tales of the Black Freighter:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/black-freighter_4710.jpg)

--  
11) Veidt A:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/veidt-logo_4063.jpg)

--  
12) Veidt B:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/veidt-logo4_6679.jpg)

--  
13) Mason's Auto Repairs:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/masons3_5556.jpg)

--  
14) Rockefeller Military Research Center:

15) The Times They Are A'Changing:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541im_/http:/typophile.com/files/nostalgia2_4052.jpg)
author: zap_rowsdower

comments.content:
zap, here's a start for the first 5.

if you use the 'insert image', it makes things a bit easier to ID these. ;)

1. Hand lettered, not a font — lots of sans fonts are similar, including Granby.  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/granby/")

2. Hand lettered, not a font

3. Hand Lettered, closest to Cloister Black  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/cloister-black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/cloister-black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/cloister-black/")

4. Helvetica Black  
 [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica/black/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica/black/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/helvetica/black/")

5. Hand lettered, not a font
You might want to check out [Comicraft](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.comicraft.com/).

13 and 14 are also hand-lettered

Besides Comicraft, here are some good comic book resources.

[http://www.ninjalettering.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.ninjalettering.com/ "http://www.ninjalettering.com/")

[http://kleinletters.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/kleinletters.com/ "http://kleinletters.com/")

[http://www.blambot.com/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121101035541/http:/www.blambot.com/ "http://www.blambot.com/")

Okay, I've uploaded all the images to make things easier.

Also, I fully understand that many of these "fonts" were hand-lettered by the illustrator. What I'm looking for are the _closest real world counterparts_ to these hand-lettered "fonts."
